meanings.definition: Having a strong affinity for water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophilic sponge absorbed all the water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophilic fabric dried faster than the others.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophilic plant loved the rain so much, it danced in the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her hydrophilic nature drew people to her like a magnet to water.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophilic surface shimmered with moisture, reflecting the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.sent1: The hydrophilic paper soaked up the spilled drink in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophilic soil retained moisture for the thirsty plants.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophilic towel was so thirsty, it gulped down every drop of water.
meanings.sent4: His hydrophilic hair seemed to attract rain clouds wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophilic sponge drank up the spilled water eagerly, leaving the surface dry.

meanings.definition: Capable of interacting with water molecules.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophilic substance mixed easily with water, forming a solution.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophilic molecules bonded seamlessly with the water molecules.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophilic fish swam happily in its water-filled tank.
meanings.sent4: Her hydrophilic smile seemed to light up like water catching the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophilic material embraced the water molecules, creating a harmonious blend.
